title: docs: test all the readme examples
body: I also removed the `anyhow` dependency in the examples to make them easier to use, and to make the error module more visible.

title: feat: expose DatabaseVersion
body: The DatabaseVersion should be part of the public interface since it is part of the DatabaseConfig

title: docs: group the usage examples
body: This will group the usage examples in the README and make them foldable, to make sure that the README is easier to scroll through. The result can be seen [here](https://github.com/sseemayer/keepass-rs/blob/db5837b957dc0d7e6305eb1a90b50d76f8c97802/README.md)

title: docs: remove duplicate doc link
body: We already have a badge that links to the documentation, so this header is superfluous.

title: feat!: parse colors
body:
Instead of storing raw hex strings, create a Color struct and implement parsing and dumping for that.

BREAKING CHANGE: Color fields are not Strings, but Color values now.

title: feat: expose CustomIcons, Icon, MemoryProtection
body: Some fields of the Meta struct were not having pub visibility.

title: feat!: parse base64-encoded UUID values
body:
Closes #131

Instead of keeping the UUIDs of objects around as base64-encoded strings, actually parse them into Uuid objects. This also fixes some issues where UUID strings instead of base64-encoded UUIDs were serialized into the XML files.

BREAKING CHANGE: Changed type of UUID values from String to `uuid::Uuid`

title: feat!: support DeletedObjects
body:
Closes #114

Parses and Dumps DeletedObject fields from the Root

BREAKING CHANGE: Adds new deleted_objects field to Database.

title: ci: cancel in progress workflows on prs
body: This commit will cancel the CI workflow when additional changes are pushed to the PR.

title: refactor!: clean up public interface
body:
This commit minimizes the public interface of the crate, and restructures it to make the docs more legible.

BREAKING CHANGE: Many visibility changes.

BREAKING CHANGE: Renamed and moved several types around.

BREAKING CHANGE: New Key type used to specify password and keyfile.

title: refactor!: clean up error types
body:
Properly chain getrandom::Error and make Database::new infallible since no more random data needs to be generated

BREAKING CHANGE: Database::new returns Self instead of Result<Self>.
BREAKING CHANGE: DatabaseSaveError::Random contains the actual Error type inside it.

title: refactor: add KDF seed generation to KdfSettings
body: See https://github.com/sseemayer/keepass-rs/pull/116#discussion_r1096788746

title: refactor: extract hmac key end magic value
body: Extract another magic value that was duplicated between the parsing and dumping code into a constant.

title: chore: use constant for KDBX version
body: See https://github.com/sseemayer/keepass-rs/pull/116#discussion_r1096788388

title: refactor!: split BinaryAttachment and HeaderAttachment
body:
Closes #117

Since the fields for an attachment inside of a <Meta> tag and inside of a KDBX4 binary header are different, make the distinction explicit by splitting up the types

BREAKING CHANGE: New type for header_attachments field in Database
BREAKING CHANGE: Fewer members for BinaryAttachment parsed from XML

title: ci: disable target for differential coverage
body:
The latest merges in `master` didn't fail, but I still think the patch behavior will cause problems in the future. The current `patch` config would fail if <80% of the **new** code is not covered. I think this is not useful because we already enforce a target for the overall codebase, and we will fail if the overall coverage drops by >10%.

There's a [`dry_run`](https://github.com/codecov/codecov-action#arguments) option in the codecov action that prevents the step from uploading the results. I think we could use that to also enforce the current coverage from within the PRs. This would allow us to enforce a certain coverage % before merging to master. We can wait until the library is more stable to enable that.

title: refactor!: never store keys or seeds
body:
Instead of overwriting the various key seeds and IVs and testing that they were overwritten, only keep the buffers around during parsing and dynamically regenerate them during dumping.

BREAKING CHANGE: Database interface changed so that headers are not exposed directly anymore, but instead only DatabaseSettings are.

title: refactor: reduce allocations
body:
Make the dumping and variant dictionary code more idiomatic by reducing the number of clones and temporary allocations.

Changes the code to use `std::io::Write` instead of returning `Vec<u8>` and to use more references instead of cloning owned values.

title: fix: pin the minor kdbx4 version to 0
body: I'm not sure where I took `3` from, but the minor value I'm getting when creating a database from KeePassXC is `0`. I also saw `4.1`, but I'm unable to recreate a database with that minor version. It might be related to the KDF or encryption schemes used.

title: ci: avoid codecov patch failures
body:
I think I finally found out what the problem was. The `status` codecov job was configured, but we were not configuring the `patch` job, as documented [here](https://docs.codecov.com/docs/commit-status#patch-status). It should now only fail if the coverage goes below 80%, or if the coverage drops by more than 10% in a single commit.

I also removed the `fail_ci_if_error`. Excerpt from the [doc](https://github.com/codecov/codecov-action#arguments):
```
Specify if CI pipeline should fail when Codecov runs into errors during upload.
```
I think we want visibility on upload errors, so that we can troubleshoot what happened and fix the workflow.

title: feat: regenerate the ivs on db save
body: This commit extract a `generate_ivs` function so that we can generate new IVs both when creating a new database and when saving an existing database. The new unit test is a bit too weak, because we only test test `master_seed`, and because we don't validate that the IVs were regenerated *before* dumping the encrypted database. I'm not sure yet how we could improve that. I tried comparing the raw encrypted databases, but they already differ when using the `master` codebase, I'm guessing because of another source of randomness in the encryption process.

title: docs: use full project name in README
body: To make sure that there's no ambiguity about the project name, if accessed from the source code directly instead of github.

title: ci: prevent ci failure from coverage job
body: This job keeps failing as soon as the coverage drops even by a single line. I didn't find any tarpaulin or `codecov-action` option to disable that behavior, so I suggest we just ignore the failures for the moment. I'm also setting the `fail-under` option to make it explicit what our current coverage target is.

title: refactor: rename parse module to format
body: Since the module contains both the parsing and the dumping code for the various database formats.

title: feat!: expose KDBX4 saving behind feature flag
body:
- [x] Create feature flag and change visibility
- [x] Update docs with disclaimers
- [x] Fix issues with opening created files
- [x] Test drive the feature somewhat to prevent catastrophic data losses

title: refactor: clean up assigning of seed for new db
feat: add a kp-get-version utility
body:
This can be useful for doing basic sanity checks on keepass database, to make sure that they have not been corrupted.
I think in the future we could merge some of the utilities into a single CLI binary, which would make it easier to discover the different features offered by the binaries in the crate.

title: refactor: extract database version enum
body: This PR centralizes all the code related to database version parsing and dumping, and eliminates duplicated database version parsing code. Some unused version related fields in the headers are also removed.

title: feat!: implement remaining XML fields
body:
Now that we have a solid testing framework and the parsing and dumping infrastructure has matured, hammer out the final missing fields from the XML database

- [x] Parse and dump `Group` fields
- [x] Parse and dump `Entry` fields


BREAKING CHANGE: Adds additional fields to Group and Entry

title: chore(ci): move tarpaulin config to file
body:
To aid local running of coverage reports, create a .tarpaulin.toml file that mimics the settings of the GitHub actions workflow.

Also updates the version of the tarpaulin image in the workflow.

title: chore(xml): additional tests for parsing
body: Mostly to cover that the parsers fail in an expected way.

title: feat!: parse and dump all Meta fields
body:
Implement reading and writing of all database metadata.

BREAKING CHANGE: `recyclebin_uuid` is now an `Option<String>`

title: refactor(xml)!: split into modules
body:
Work on the `xml_parse` module to split parsing and dumping code into separate submodules and reduce repetitive code, in preparation for adding additional fields from the XML format.

- [x] split out dumping
- [x] refactor dumping to use a shared trait
- [x] split out parsing
- [x] refactor parsing to use a shared trait

title: ci: cargo check all feature combinations
body: This PR updates the `check` CI step to test all combinations of features. This should catch more bugs before they get merged into master, especially as we plan on adding more features to the crate. I also fixed a compilation error that made its way into master.

title: refactor(totp): cleanup and error handling
body: This PR includes several smaller changes to harmonize the OTP codebase with the rest of the crate.

title: ci: add a workflow to lint commits
body:
The default help URL will be [this one](https://github.com/conventional-changelog/commitlint/#what-is-commitlint), but we can change it if we find it not helpful enough. For example, we could redirect to our own `CONTRIBUTING.md` once we have one.
This is required before we can add a workflow that automates the releases after a merge on master.

title: ci: remove travis config
body: Travis is no longer used for CI, so we can remove the configuration entirely. The only thing in there that we might want to salvage are the custom `-C target-feature=+aes,+sse2` Rust flags. @DavidVentura is this related to the note you added to the README in 36a91a3334a60a07508994b476c76f35f012d73c ?

title: ci: add target and threshold for codecov
body: The codecov action started failing in the last commits, for example because the coverage decreased by -0.06%... I don't think this is productive, so I'm adding a threshold of 10% before considering that a merge failed the coverage test.

title: fix: Prevent stack overflow due to circular type conversions of nested error types
body:
Hi
Only adding a test because I don't understand what the problem is
When working on the TOTP PR, I noticed that providing a bad password gave:
```
fatal runtime error: stack overflow
```

I've isolated it to this `Error` type conversion, but the `#Error` macro is magic

title: feat: use argon2 kdf settings
body:
When I modified the database creation function to actually use the argon2 settings, I started seeing the following test errors:
```
thread 'xml_parse::xml_tests::test_entry' has overflowed its stack
```

Looks like there's a minimum memory required to derive the hashed password with argon2. I'm wondering if we should provide a default value, and a minimum value, to make sure that the value is large enough. I didn't see any recommendations on the crate's documentation.

title: refactor: rename database creation fn
body: `_database` is redundant in that case, and `::new` is already the name used by the `Group` and `Entry` structs.

title: chore: reduce verbosity of xml write calls
body: since we will have to write a lot more of those, let's make it slightly shorter

title: chore: remove unused PartialEq on Compression
Add basic otp support
body:
Hi
I'll try to pull features off my fork into this one, not sure how applicable they are

* Add basic otp support
* Add bin for TOTP printing
* Return code with validity duration

title: ci: use acronym for ci job
body: The long form takes a lot of place in the README, so I suggest we use this well-known acronym instead.

title: fix: pin the tarpaulin image and use stable rust
body:
The current coverage workflow is failing with the latest tarpaulin image, as seen [here](https://github.com/sseemayer/keepass-rs/actions/runs/3912616535/jobs/6687480974).
This PR switches to the latest stable release instead. I tested locally, and I was able to generate the coverage report.

I think we'll also have to update the coverage badge in the README. The current codecov project page displays the following error message:
```
 This repo has been deactivated 
```

title: docs: update build status badge to gha
body: The build status badge was still redirecting to travis-ci, with the last build being 3 years old.

title: ci: migrate code coverage to gha
body:
This PR migrates the code coverage CI job from Travis to GitHub Actions. The code is based on [the tarpaulin documentation](https://github.com/xd009642/tarpaulin/tree/master/#github-actions). Since this is a public repository, we don't need to provide a token to codecov for the upload to work (see https://github.com/codecov/codecov-action#usage)

The workflow will only be triggered when merging to master.

title: refactor: extract kdbx4 parsing constants
body:
Another preliminary PR to https://github.com/sseemayer/keepass-rs/pull/58
Those constants will be used when writing databases as well, so I'm extracting them, along with the comments accompanying them.

title: chore: bump base64 to latest minor version
body:
New version was published today, Some functions were marked as deprecated, so this PR will migrate to the newer form.
[Release notes are here](https://github.com/marshallpierce/rust-base64/commit/b59e4ea530bbcd030e0ddbda9cefc0ba8983a4f5)

title: refactor: remove parsing artifact from headers
body: The `body_start` are parsing artifacts and do not belong in the header. This will become obvious when creating a new database from scratch. This commit removes the `body_start` from the headers and simply returns them from the parsing functions.

title: docs: add a license badge
body: We love README badges.

title: refactor: extract names for kdf variants
body: These consts will be used when writing databases.

title: fix: typo in kdf error name
refactor: extract cipher ids
body: These consts will also be used when writing databases.

title: refactor: extract consts from variant dict parsing
body: Those same constants will be used when writing databases.

title: chore: fix compilation warnings
body: This will remove the warnings that are being displayed on every PR.

title: ci: do not run tests on every push
body: This will make sure that we don't run all the steps twice when working directly from the repo and not from a fork.

title: chore: avoid vulnerable chrono version
body:
This will make sure we avoid using the vulnerability described [here](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2020-0159.html)
The locked version is already 0.4.23, but consuming projects do not use the `Cargo.lock`

title: ci: add codeowners
refactor: extract get_key_elements fns
body: This is a small refactoring to extract the `key_elements` generation function. It will be used elsewhere in the codebase when adding the KDBX4 support.

title: ci: isolate the armv7 regression test
body:
This moves the armv7 regression test to a separate job, so that failures in the regression tests are not confused with failures when running all the unit tests. The armv7 regression test was added today in https://github.com/sseemayer/keepass-rs/pull/45, and has been failing since. I tried fixing the test but was not able to so far, so I think splitting the test is a good compromise for now, so that we can rely on the unit tests again.
cc @DavidVentura 

I also removed reference to the `action-rs/cargo` action, because the rust toolchain is already installed by the `action-rs/toolchain` action. It's even recommended to do so by the action authors: https://github.com/actions-rs/cargo#use-cases

title: ci: add a rustfmt linting job
body: Fixes https://github.com/sseemayer/keepass-rs/issues/51 because the CI job will enforce the default `rustfmt` style.

title: Implement KDBX4 database saving
body:
This is a first draft for KDBX4 database saving support. This is still a WIP, but I wanted to open the PR now in order to get early feedback. This PR also includes some refactorings that could be extracted to separate PRs in order to make the code review easier and safer.

Fixes https://github.com/sseemayer/keepass-rs/issues/14

## TODO
- [x] Implement AES `encrypt`
- [x] Implement TwoFish `encrypt`
- [x] Implement Salsa20 `encrypt`
- [x] Implement ChaCha20 `encrypt`
- [x] Implement GZip `compress`
- [x] Dump binary attachments
- [x] Implement protected attributes

title: Bumps version of rust-argon2
body:
Github informed me of a security issue on [Medic](https://github.com/sts10/medic), namely "crossbeam-utils Race Condition vulnerability", linking to [this merge](https://github.com/crossbeam-rs/crossbeam/pull/781).
 
After some digging in `cargo tree`, I learned that keepass-xc depends on rust-argon2, which [depends on](https://github.com/sru-systems/rust-argon2/blob/master/Cargo.toml#L24) crossbeam-utils. 

Luckily, I think version 1.0 of rust-argon2 seems to use a safe version of crossbeam-utils ("0.8"). This PR simply bumps keepass-rs's rust-argon2 dependency to v 1.0. Tests pass.

title: feat: add tags parsing
body:
I added tags to the entry in the test database in order to test the changes.
The groups don't have tags, so no need to handle that case.

title: Add URL to entry
body: Adds a function for returning a URL for the `Entry`.

title: docs: use readme for create doc
body:
This will populate the crate documentation page with everything in the README. It also avoids duplicating the same example in two places, and makes sure that the examples in the README are tested.

@sseemayer thanks for the review :pray:

title: feat: parse group and entry uuids
body:
This PR implements UUID parsing for both entries and groups. Some of the code overlaps with [DavidVentura:recycle-uuid](https://github.com/sseemayer/keepass-rs/pull/43), but I tried to keep the implementations similar to minimize potential conflicts.

@sseemayer thanks for reviewing :eyes:

title: Updated dependecies and fixed issues related to them.
body:
Could not update the AES dependency as it is affected by the deprecation of block-cipher, no easy replacement for ECB mode required for KDBX versions <4. Could have hacked it with a manual version but decided it was better to get the others up and running with the latest versions (which should bring some performance benefits on some platforms).

Results was changed due to unification of some results value upstream. Seems that there is less differentiation now on the key lengths etc. There is now a padding error that is returned, but should be careful about how that's exposed, as that way leads to oracle attacks if you're not careful. Not necessarily an issue for libraries but something to be born in mind for anything that uses this and returns data to users.

title: Faster performance on kdf
body:
Hi!
Currently KDBX3 databases open _very_ slowly,
With this new implementation by @newpavlov ([here](https://github.com/RustCrypto/block-ciphers/issues/285#issuecomment-915097797)) the execution is about ~10x faster

title: Fix KDBX4 key calculation on 32 bit platforms
body:
This fixes #41 
Calculations were using `usize` and the values are >2^32 (apparently) -- a simple replace with u64 seems to work.
Added 1 test to CI on arm32 as it is _very_ slow right now. (I am investigating why)

title: Add note on performance for AArch64/ARMv8
Implement DB Metadata, Group UUID
body:
This fixes #42 
This commit implements a Metadata field for Database, whose only
member is 'recyclebin_uuid' (String).

It also implements a `uuid` field for Group, that can be matched with
the database's `meta.recyclebin_uuid`

I'll try to figure out how to get this tested as well. I don't know anything about the KDBX formats so I'm not sure if this also applies to v1 (which seems to not share the parser compared to v3/4?)

title: Updating Tests for KDBX4 File Issue
body:
If you want to write your tests differently, I will remove this PR.  If you do want this change, I will mark it as ready to review and merge.

This is the Draft PR promised when #33 was created.

Please let me know if you think I can be of any additional assistance with this.
